questions.question: Clicking a link in an unexpected email from your bank.
questions.explanation: It could be a phishing attempt. Always visit the official website directly.

questions.question: Using the same password for multiple accounts.
questions.explanation: If one site gets breached, all your accounts become vulnerable.

questions.question: Enabling two-factor authentication (2FA).
questions.explanation: 2FA adds a second layer of security to your login process.

questions.question: Using public Wi-Fi without a VPN.
questions.explanation: Public Wi-Fi is easy to intercept. Always use a VPN when available.

questions.question: Checking for HTTPS in the browser before entering credentials.
questions.explanation: HTTPS encrypts your data and ensures a secure connection.

questions.question: Installing unknown browser extensions.
questions.explanation: Extensions can access and steal your data if they're malicious.

questions.question: Using biometric authentication on your phone.
questions.explanation: Biometric login adds convenience and an extra security layer.

questions.question: Leaving your devices unlocked in public places.
questions.explanation: Someone could access your data or install malware.

questions.question: Using a password manager.
questions.explanation: Password managers generate and store strong, unique passwords.
